text.more: Dio is an important historian whose works overlap with Plutarch's subjects. This sociogram allows users to compare Dio's network to Plutarchs. Dio focuses far less on personal interactions and more on the political and military narrative. His inclusion of long speeches also eliminates opportunities for his subjects to interact.
text.intro:
This graph shows the social networks described in Dio books 36-47.

Nodes: 289

Unique Edges: 787

Average Path: 2.95

Clustering Coefficient: 57.5%
text.title: Roman Networks in Dio
